meanings.definition: Pertaining to or situated in the spaces between cells or parts of a structure.
meanings.sent1: The interstitial fluid helps transport nutrients between cells.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the interstitial spaces to understand tissue structure.
meanings.sent3: The interstitial areas in the sponge cake make it extra fluffy.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the interstitial gaps in the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The interstitial design of the building allows for natural light to flow through.

meanings.definition: Relating to or occurring in the intervals between events or periods.
meanings.sent1: The interstitial pauses in the music added suspense.
meanings.sent2: Intermittent rain showers are an interstitial feature of the season.
meanings.sent3: The interstitial breaks in the movie kept the audience guessing.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts wandered into interstitial moments of reflection.
meanings.sent5: The interstitial silence between their words spoke volumes.

meanings.definition: A small advertisement or promotional message that appears between content on a website or app.
meanings.sent1: The website displayed an interstitial before loading the main page.
meanings.sent2: Users often close interstitials quickly to access the content.
meanings.sent3: The interstitial popped up just as she was about to click.
meanings.sent4: The interstitial caught the attention of many users with its bright colors.
meanings.sent5: An interstitial can sometimes disrupt the flow of browsing on a site.
